Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can draw simple representations of a variety of basic habitats, such as a basic garden and a simple pond.
The student can illustrate a few types of living things like trees, simple bushes, and fish in the water.
The student may attempt to show some basic pattern of how some plants or animals live in different places, though not always accurately.
CANNOT: The student may not consistently illustrate a diverse range of living things within each habitat (only a few types like all bushes in a garden) (limited diversity shown).
The student is likely unable to clearly label their drawings or may only partially label them (labels are missing or incorrect).
The student may misunderstand and draw inaccurate comparisons between habitats, such as placing fish in a garden (misplacement of species).
The student might inconsistently apply observations from media or experiences, leading to disorganized or unclear drawings.
